attributes.comment:
I am against raising the fees for paperwork that must be generated for International
and National adoptions. This will discourage some people from persuing adoption.
When my husband and I decided to start a family, we wanted to adopt. Looking at
the costs of adoption, we decided to try to have biological children. After persuing
treatment that did not work, we decided that, instead of continuing with infertility
treatments, we would put that money toward adopting. It took us years to save up
enough money to finally bring our son home. We have not adopted again, although
we truly want to in our hearts, because of the cost involved. There is no reason to
continue to raise the costs of the paperwork required. As it was, we had to redo
our fingerprints and our I 600 because they had "expired," thus increasing our
costs on an already tight budget. I feel the important thing to remember is to
encourage people who want to expand their family by adoption, not add another
element to discourage. Increasing the fees by about 66% is completely
unreasonable. There should be no reason that the fees need to increase by such
a dramatic number. I would encourage you to streamline your paperwork
processes, increase the "expiration" date, and look at combining what paperwork
you require if you need to decrease the costs of processing such paperwork, and
not to increase the fees.
Thank you,
Kelly Ryder

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kelly D. Ryder
